comments: Turner (IND) brings his forearm forward towards Washington (CHA) and marginal contact occurs as Washington cuts across the perimeter.
Hield (IND) moves alongside Ball's (CHA) path and absorbs the marginal body contact that occurs during the driving shot attempt.
Ball's (CHA) shot attempt makes contact with the backboard, and he legally touches the ball after his shot attempt.
Ball (CHA) briefly rests his hand on Nesmith's (IND) shoulder and he immediately removes his hand as they pursue the rebound.
Nesmith (IND) cleanly dislodges the ball from Ball (CHA) during rebounding.
Ball (CHA) makes contact with the back of Nesmith's (IND) head, which causes Nesmith to fall to the floor.  This contact occurs prior to, and causes, any contact from Nesmith to Ball's head.
Nesmith (IND) and Hayward (CHA) briefly engage and disengage off ball during the screen.
Williams (CHA) is already in Brown's (IND) path when contact occurs and he does not deliver contact.
Hayward (CHA) brings his hand towards Nesmith's (IND) side as he dribbles in the post, and the contact is marginal.
Nesmith (IND) is moving alongside Hayward's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs with Hayward's slightly extended right knee as he elevates for the shot.
Turner (IND) firms up over his left leg and absorbs the contact from Miller (CHA) to his upper body.
Haliburton (IND) keeps his hand on the side of the ball and does not bring part of his hand under the ball when he brings his dribble to a pause.
Turner (IND) is firming up over his left leg in Washington's (CHA) path and he absorbs the contact to his upper body.
As Turner (IND) turns toward the basket, his left arm moves forward towards Williams (CHA), and marginal contact occurs as Williams elevates to receive the pass.
Turner (IND) contests Williams' (CHA) shot near the rim and marginal contact occurs with Williams' slightly extended right leg.
Brown (IND) is firming up over his left leg and absorbs the contact from MIller (CHA) to his upper body.
Miller (CHA) is in the paint for longer than three seconds without imminently actively guarding an opponent.
Hield's (IND) right hand cleanly dislodges the ball from Washington (CHA).  Any ensuing arm contact after the dislodge is considered marginal.
Hield (IND) dislodges the ball from Washington (CHA), which causes Washington to fumble the ball as he loses control.  Washington then legally regains possession as he returns to the floor.
Nesmith (IND) applies his right hand to Washington's (CHA) side, and marginal contact occurs as Nesmith's left hand simultaneously dislodges the ball from Washington.

call_type: Turnover: Lost Ball Out of Bounds
comments: Replay review of the out of bounds called on Nesmith (IND) pursuant to a coach's challenge was deemed successful. Washington (CHA) is the last player to touch the ball, and possession is correctly awarded to Indiana.
Turner (IND) is already in Washington's (CHA) path when contact occurs and he absorbs the contact.
Haliburton's (IND) momentum carries him forward towards Williams (CHA) as Williams is turning away from the contact, which is marginal.

Replay review of the foul called on Miller (CHA) pursuant to a coach's challenge was deemed unsuccessful. Miller (CHA) is late to the spot and does not establish a legal guarding position in Hield's (IND) path prior to contact.
Turner (IND) and Williams (CHA) briefly engage and disengage during rebounding.
Williams (CHA) is the last player to touch the ball before the ball goes out of bounds.  Possession is correctly awarded to Indiana.
Turner (IND) wraps Williams (CHA) and the contact dislodges Williams as he attempts to secure the loose ball.
Nesmith (IND) and Washington (CHA) come together at the same spot and marginal contact occurs as they pursue the loose ball.
Hayward (CHA) grabs and holds Hield's (IND) left arm, which affects his ability to secure the loose ball.
As Williams (CHA) gathers the loose ball, marginal lower body contact occurs as he turns towards Turner (IND) while releasing the pass.
Charlotte requests, and is granted, a timeout after Miller (CHA) gains control of the ball.
Hield (IND) momentarily rests his hand on Washington's (CHA) side and marginal contact occurs as the two players disengage during the inbound.
Hield (IND) cleanly dislodges the ball from Washington (CHA) as he defends the shot near the rim.
Washington (CHA) is the last player to touch the ball before it goes out of bounds. Possession is correctly awarded to Indiana.
Brown (IND) firms up in Miller's (CHA) path and does not deliver illegal contact when setting the pick.
Ball (CHA) cleanly deflects the ball away from Haliburton (IND) on the perimeter.
